intro: Agalinis harperi, commonly known as the slender bluetail, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and sand hills. It produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Agalinis harperi is a short-lived perennial, often found in disturbed soils and is considered a rare species in some regions.
